sentences.en: Esau sold his birthright to Jacob for a mess of pottage.
sentences.cn: 以扫为了一碗红豆汤儿把长子的财产继承权卖给了雅各.

sentences.en: Freedom is the longing of every soul and the birthright of all mankind.
sentences.cn: 所有的灵魂都向往自由,自由是全体人类与生具来的权力.

sentences.en: Freedom of speech is every American’s birthright.
sentences.cn: 言论自由是每一个美国人与生俱来的权利。

sentences.en: Inwardness is what an Englishman quite simply has, painlessly, as a birthright.
sentences.cn: 内省是英国人与生俱来,不用费力培养就拥有的特质.

sentences.en: Jacob replied, " First sell me your birthright. "
sentences.cn: 31雅各说, 你今日把长子的 名分 卖给我吧.

sentences.en: Man sacrifices his individuality, his " birthright , " for a pottage of lentils.
sentences.cn: 人会为了肉汤而牺牲他的个人独立性和生存权.

sentences.en: The estate is the birthright of the eldest son.
sentences.cn: 长子对这份地产有继承权.

sentences.en: The prodigal son claimed his birthright early and left home.
sentences.cn: 那个浪子提前把他的遗产要走了,然后离开了家.

sentences.en: The property is the birthright of the eldest child.
sentences.cn: 长子享有财产的继承权。

words.tran_cn: 与生俱来的权利；长子继承权

trans.tran_cn: 与生俱来的权利，由于出身、国籍等而获得的权利
trans.tran_en: something such as a right, property, money etc that you believe you should have because of the family or country you belong to
